inn1.comm: Whack! Smith sets the ball rolling in the first Quarter-final with a cracking square cut. Two slips in place and Smith spanks it past point. It was shortish and outside off and Smith loves to cut
bowls this straighter and Smith respects the line and length by tapping it back to the bowler
shout for lbw but it  pitched outside leg. It was full in length, landed just outside leg and straightened to hit the pad in front of the leg stump.

lovely delivery. Just a bad ball first up but tight after that. This one straightens just outside off, Smith had a waft outside the line, he wasn't expecting the ball to straighten at all. The ball went through bat and pad gap to the keeper
takes this one away but Smith had his off stump covered and shouldered arms.

another one that straightens and whenever Gul has done that Smith has been in trouble. This one probably seams back a bit from the middle stump line and moves past the defensive prod to hit the thigh pad.
from round the stumps on the off stump line, Gayle gets forward to push it to the on side. Inside edge there.
Shout for lbw Pad first or bat first? It came in with the arm and Gayle was late in picking it. He just about managed to stab it to his pad
this one slips down leg for a wide
on the middle, again looking for that lbw, and Gayle gets the bat in front of the pad to defend
around the off stump, pushed away to short midwicket
Smack! The first ball that Hafeez flighted and Gayle pounces immediately. It was around off stump and he dragged it to wide midwicket boundary.
leans well forward to defend this one to the leg side
lands around middle and off and cuts away sharply. Smith was on the back foot and poked out at it. he didn't quite get close to it, though.
this one cuts across from outside leg and Smith gets back to deflect it to midwicket for a single
Walloped! The Gayle charge is on. He rushed down the track, got outside the leg in the process and smashed this length delivery on the up and over mid-off.
Ah! lovely stuff from Gul who goes for the yorker on the off stump line and Gayle digs it out back down the track.

Gul takes out Gayle. And he jumps in joy. It was a full length delivery around off; Gayle backed outside leg and went for his powerful lofted hit. He didn't get the elevation and the ball screamed to right of mid-off where who else but Shahid Afridi pouches it. Now then.. huge pressure on this West Indies team. How will they respond?
lovely probing delivery in the corridor outside off, Sarwan gets forward and across, covers his off stump and shoulders arms
gets back to push to cover
gets back to try clipping this one to the leg but it rolls off the pad
turns away from the off stump, first sign of spin, pushed back to the bowler
leans forward to push it to mid-on for a quick single
on the leg stump, nudged to short fine-leg
quicker, around the off stump line, defended to cover
short and outside of stump, Smith cuts it hard to point where there is a slight fumble. It was hit very powerfully.
in the zone outside off and Sarwan lets it go through to Akmal
fuller in length, probing to see if Sarwan is late in getting forward; he is but manages to push this one away to the on side of the pitch
Shout for a catch by Kamran. It was in the zone outside off and Sarwan went for a big cut shot. Kamran screamed out. They don't get for a review. No noise as the ball went past the bat
Gul continues to impress. This one lands on a good length just outside off and sort of holds its line. Sarwan shoulders arms again. Will he get on to cut back in
full in length around off stump, Sarwan mistimes his drive to mid-off

West Indies are wobbling here. If they don't take care, they would land in complete chaos soon. This one came in with the arm, as most Hafeez deliveries do, but West Indies are yet to figure him out. Smith was caught at the crease and he poked outside the line. Pretty clueless and the ball nailed him in front of the middle. Looked dead plumb.
Almost out! It was full in length on the off stump line, Bravo was caught off guard. He was shaping to get back and cut. Yeah cut! It was too full and he managed to get back in line to stab it away
leans forward to defend to the on side

Bravo has been given out lbw and Windies go for review. Another one of those straighter ones from Hafeez. It landed full on a length on the off stump line and drifted in towards the leg stump line. Bravo was pushing way outside the line. Again, no clue about Hafeez's strength. That would have hit the leg stump. He is gone and West Indies are in disarray now.
That's the way to play it. he gets the bat in front of the pad to defend it down the track
turns this to Gul at short fine-leg region
leans forward to drive this to the off side
on the middle stump line, pushed out to the on side

That old problem of Sarwan. He does get squared up when the ball straightens on the off stump line. For a top-order batsman, I am always surprised how much he gets squared up by that delivery. Edges this one to third man
goes for the yorker, Chanderpaul works it to midwicket
goes for the short pitched delivery in the zone outside off, Chanders arrests his shuffles, and sways away
shuffles across, gets behind the line of delivery moving across from the leg stump line and defends
Shout for a stumping chance It was the straighter one outside off stump, Sarwan stretches forward to defend and drags his back foot on the line. He manages to get it back inside
gets back to defend this to the on side
leans forward to defend to the on side.
drifts down the leg side, brushes the pad and Kamran takes it neatly. And even appeals!
leans forward to push this to midwicket
around the off stump line, squeezed out to backward point region
pretty wide outside off stump, Sarwan thinks about the cut shot but resists.
short in length outside off stump, punched out to cover
stays back to punch this to the off side. He then taps the pitch in front of him, before taking a stroll to the leg side. He adjusts his gloves and returns
a low swinging full toss, Sarwan hits it hard but straight to cover. He then suggests he should have timed it through extra cover instead of going after it hard
short in length, bounces in to the middle, pushed out to the off side
in the zone outside off stump, teasing short length but Sars lets it go through
quicker one, with the arm, stabbed to the on side
on the middle stump line, defended to the off
flighted on the middle, wristed to midwicket
just outside off stump, cut away to point
around the off stump line, slower, guided to backward point region
on the middle stump line, straightens, Chanderpaul was looking to work it to the on side and edges it to the off
on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
full in length on the middle, straightens, defended to the leg side
full in length on the middle stump line, defended to the off
fullish outside off, mistimes his drive to cover
full delivery on the off and middle, turned to right of mid-on. Direct hit. Overthrows? Nope, Chanders shouts out no.
short in length around off stump line, that shuffle again and he defends to the off
punches this out wide of mid-on for a single
drifts down the leg for a wide and Kamran does well to gather it
lunges forward to defend and the ball runs of the inner edge.
lunges out again to block this one to the leg side
slower, flighted full, driven to long-off
leans forward to nudge this to cover
quicker, flatter, on the middle and off line, pushed away to the on side. The ball bounced in front of mid-on fielder and hit him on the head. not sure who he was.
stays back to defend to the off side
leans forward to work this length delivery to the on side and ends up chipping it aerially but in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
full in length and on the pads, and Sarwan gets a tickle on it. It runs down to fine-leg boundary. The last four was by Gayle.
overpitches on the off stump line, driven to mid-off. Mistimes it again
Gorgeous. Sars' first good shot. The first bit he timed. It was a length delivery angled across him and he caressed it through extra cover.
The poor over continues. Awry release. Wide down the leg
stays back to defend this length delivery to the on side of the pitch
leans forward to dab this to the off
leans forward to defend this to the leg side
lunges out to block this off break outside off
Chanders is stabbing and jabbing them. This one he chops to the on side.
on the middle, gets the bat in front of the pad to push it to the off
fuller, turned to midwicket. Maiden over.
from round the stumps, full in length outside off, defended to point
full in length on the middle, mistimes his drive to mid-on
moves in from outside off, defended to the off
cut in from outside off and rolls off the thigh pad Free hit coming up
Moves outside leg, Wahab hurls it outside off and Chanderpaul reaches out to jab it behind point for a single
from round the stumps, full and wide outside off.
cuts in from outside off, Sarwan opens the bat-face to steer it to point
full in length, around off, driven straight to mid-off
fuller on off, Chanders leans out to defend. Languid and pointless.
he skips out this time, but Hafeez holds the length back and he adjusts for the spin to defend again
drifting into the pads, Chanders finally gets a single, working towards square leg
short of a length outside off, Sarwan stays back and punches to the right of the pitch. Hafeez stops the ball.
this time Sarwan places the punch away from Hafeez, through mid on for a single
drifts onto the pads, Sarwan tries to glance but finds short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, Sarwan defends to the off side

This seems like a ridicuous review for lbw. Sarwan has jumped out of the crease, he's atleast a couple of feet outside as he defends with bat and pad close together. Googly from Afridi, lands outside off and jams into bat and pad. Or is it pad and bat? The distance is over 2.5 m. Impact is outside the line. The only thing going for the appeal is that the ball is hitting off stump. The decision stays.

similar ball, similar appeal, same decision, but this time no referral. Sarwan was again out of the crease, but if anything this time he was hit in line. Hmm. Replays in. It was barely clipping the top of middle.
holds the length back, Sarwan feels for it after getting half forward and defends
interesting first over from Afridi, it is a maiden as Sarwan glances another one drifting into the pads, and Hafeez does well at short fine leg.
lands on leg and comes in, Chanders defends to the leg side
turns away from middle, poked into the off side but without any intention to score
on middle again, Chanders comes forward to defend.
eventually he gets a single, as one delivery turns away sharply and bounces from middle and leg.
turning in from outside off, Sarwan forces back to the bowler off the front foot
an airy cut to end the over, Sarwan misses as Ajmal zips one past a foot outside off. Not short or wide enough for the shot.
Afridi concedes his first run as Chanders pushes a full delivery towards long off

dropped by Gul in clumsy fashion. Even Kamran looks incredulous! It wasn't that easy. Leggie from Afridi outside off, Sarwan again jumps out, gets to the flight and looks to chip over extra cover. Gul attacks the ball from widish long off at a poor angle, running sideways instead of head on. He then tries to tumble and pouch, gets his hands to it, and lets it slip.
full and wide outside off, Sarwan lets it go
he works another full ball to the leg side calmly for a single
Chanders whips with the wrists through square leg for a single
Sarwan defends a full length ball on the off stump compactly. It is all happening in Afridi's spell!
offie breaking from leg stump, Chanders adjusts for the spin and pokes to the off side
they hustle through for a couple. Chanders softly places a full delivery on off to extra cover and Sarwan hares back before the poor throw reaches Ajmal
loopy on middle and leg, Chanders tries to work it to the leg side and can't get it away
straighter, Chanders flicks straight to midwicket
turns into the pads from outside leg stump and Chanders tries to nurdle to the leg side. The ball goes no where
worked off the pads towards midwicket for a single to end the over. West Indies dawdle along.
Chanders sneaks another single, full ball outside off, dropped to the off side for one
Sarwan again looks to jump out, but Afridi holds the length back and Sarwan looks to cut. Can't get it past the point cordon.
fullish this time, driven fluently but straight to Misbah in the covers
this time he gets the single away, forcing the cut through the covers for one
googly from well outside leg, doesn't trouble Chanders who crabs away into the line of middle and works it backward of square for the 50th run
Sarwan defends a full leggie on middle off the front foot to the off side
tossed up well outside off, Chanders sees it and lets it go
straighter, on leg and middle, Chanders reaches to the pitch and defends

doosra, Chanders gets into all kinds of trouble. He plays for the offie and mistimes and mis-places the cut. Straight to slip and then Chanders wanders out of the crease, and is close to being run out
worked from leg stump towards square leg for a single
another doosra, more trouble. Lands outside leg and breaks into Sarwan who ends up getting a leading edge of sorts on his paddle sweep, to midwicket
sharp offie on leg stump, Chanders cautiously defends from the crease
Sarwan skips out to the drifting delivery on off and defends into the covers
looks to punch a length ball on the off stump into the covers but finds the fielder
Sarwan is out of the crease again, but gets too close to a full ball on leg stump and ends up mistiming a swipe to midwicket. All the same, its into the gap and he gets a couple
again Sarwan skips out of the crease, he's concerned about Afridi's lbw threat clearly. Played defensively into the off side
gets the single this time, again from out of the crease, he works it down past mid off
this is tragic enough without a run out. Sarwan almost makes it worse by running half way down the pitch as Chanders glides straight to short third man. He is able to get back in time though.
finally some width from Ajmal, Sarwan cashes in with a well-timed cut. Riaz does well sweeping to tumble as cut off the four.
slower and loopier on the off stump line, defended into the off side
Sarwan nearly, again, falls for the doosra. Back of a length outside off, and extra bounce as it holds its line. Sarwan ends up inside edging a forceful square drive and it goes close to the stumps.
slower and outside off, Sarwan gets half forward to defend
doosra dropped outside off, this time Sarwan reads it and cuts late to the man at deepish backward point
Chanders leans out to smother an offie on off stump

all over. Afridi has threatened to dismiss Sarwan right from the word go, and ends up getting him on the square drive. This time Sarwan doesn't jump out. Afridi keeps it full and a little wide of off stump, but importantly gets bounce out of the turf, and that did the trick. Sarwan went for the on the up square drive, but could not keep the shot down. The extra bounce meant, he carved it straight at Umar Akmal standing at point. West Indies are going nowhere.
fired in short of a length, angling into the pads and worked to the leg side
on off stump, Chanders of the ugliest stance in the game, pushes to the off side in ungainly style
again, Chanders dabs into the covers
fullish ball, Chanders pushes to long on. Can't believe mid on is not inside the circle.
Pollard leans out to a back of length ball and defends as it breaks in.

Dr. Chanders and Mr. Shiv. We have seen the former crabbing along until now, and out of nowhere, the latter slams a slog sweep out of Mirpur, Tossed up outside off, Chanders goes down on a knee and drop kicks it over midwicket. Finally, a shot timed well.
he pushes a single down the ground
doosra, kicks up from back of a length at a crouching Pollard who adjusts in a hurry and defends in jerky manner to the off side
fuller on middle and off, worked with the spin to the leg side
short of a length outside off, comes slower than he expected and Pollard under-edges the cut
whippy delivery, short of a length and scurrying across, Chanders nurdles straight to short fine leg
fuller and on the pads, Chanders plays it back down the track
quicker and in the blockhole, Chanders manages to dig it out down to long on for one
sliding down the leg side, Pollard misses the flick and it is called a wide

the moment of truth has come. Pollard has gone. He's not the best players of spin. And sure not the best player of the best legspinner in the ODI format now. It would have required a miracle to see him come out of this unscathed. The only miracle in that dismissal was that Kamran held a sharp chance. It was the patent Afridi quicker one, delivered from a foot wide of the stumps, comes in with the angle, darts in on a length and hurries through without deviating much outside off. Pollard went for an ill-advised cut and got an inner edge. Kamran pouched and appealed hard. It was eventually given, and Pollard trudges away.

in and out. West Indies are not even referring them. Afridi sends down a trademark thunderbolt, meaner, faster, straighter and bouncier than the previous one. In less than a twinkling, it was across the turf, skidding past Thomas' backfoot defensive, pinning him in front of middle and leg. I can't believe they did not refer it, might have been worth a try. Afridi on a hat-trick.

and the strangest shot you will see to a hat-trick ball. Full delivery, curling in towards leg stump as Sammy looks to work it to the leg side and gets a leading edge that hangs in the air menacingly before it lands at vacant square leg
dropped by Younis at slip. Not the easiest take. Offie lands on off and comes in, Sammy gets a leading edge that goes very fine and Younis dives to his left, gets his hand to it, but can't hold on.
slides one down the leg side. I wonder why. Just bowl straight, there are wickets to be had.

just like that. The West Indian captain has no answer to a delightful doosra that makes him look like a novie. Ajmal drifts it in towards off and then gets it to bite and nip away from a length. Sammy pokes away from the crease, completely befuddled by the brilliance of the ball and is struck on the crease, in front of middle. The umpire's finger went up almost before Pakistan appealed.
aha, another doosra, Bishoo thinks its going to be an offie and leaves. Not very far from the stumps.
he pokes the second ball away to the off side

West Indies are being Pakistunned here. Or should I say Paki-spun. Ajmal slips in another doosra from round the wicket. Bishoo did most things right, he leaned as far out as possible to cover the line and smother the spin. Clearly he wasn't picking the turn, but on this occasion, he did not pick the flight either. It landed a few inches short of his front foot and whizzed through the bat-pad gap to hit the stumps.
only Roach will know how he managed to survive this ball. Another doosra from over the wicket, he gropes from the crease in an attempt to cover the line and it buzzes past the outside edge
on the pads, Chanders works it to midwicket for a single.
97.2 kph, inswinging yorker. No other way to define that ball from Afridi, which Roach did well to defend
back of a length on off stump, defended more confidently to the off side
huge googly from outside off, Roach reads it off the pitch and defends to the off side off the front foot
he plays back to this one, but manages to play it away to the off side
drift down the leg side, Roach gets some pad on it away to backward fine leg for one
offie on middle, Chanders plonks forward to defend
short of a length and going away, Chanders defends resolutely
doosra short of a length and holding its line from outside off, Chanders plays back and keeps it out to the off side
Chanders doesn't want the single even off the 4th ball. Works a full ball to the leg side and refuses to run
lands on a length around off and straightens, Chanders opens the face and guides towards point
can't get a single off the final ball, and now Roach will have to face Afridi. Ouch.
Roach gets a four, using Afridi's pace to steer a cut backward of point. Short, wide and really fast, it was there to be hit.
slows it up and lands it full on off stump, Roach defends to the off side
drifting into the pads, Roach can't get it away
he gets the run this time, working Afridi with the angle through backward square leg for one
short and wide, Chanders mistimes the cut and hence gets only a single. Don't think he wanted more than a single. He now has strike.

regulation miss of a stumping from Kamran. Zipping offie outside off, leads Chanders out and he misses the flick. Kamra had to collect and break the stumps, instead it hit his glove and thudded into his chin.
leans out to a flighted ball and pushes it to the off side
top stuff from Ajmal, Chanders is left groping for a doosra, clueless as to what the ball is doing. It goes off the pad to the right of slip
works a delivery from the leg stump to the leg side for a single
another doosra. This is Shane Warne bowling with an offie's action. Roach pushes forward, misses it, gets squared up and smiles sheepishly.
short in length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
stays back to defend it back down the track
on the pads, turned out to midwicket
short in length around off, Roach gets right behind the line to play a very solid defensive push
fullish outside off, Roach crouches to steer it to third man
stays back to work this through midwicket
full in length just outside off, Chanders prefers to stay back and that's a mistake. He is beaten, pushing out at it
goes down the track to work it to the on side
slaps this from outside off to wide long-off for couple of runs
just outside off, pushed out to cover
from round the stumps, on the middle stump line, Roach defends very carefully
works this wide of backward point for a single
full delivery outside off, driven very crisply but short extra cover, Misbah, dives to stop it. Pretty good shot that
moves towards the leg stump line and runs off the pad
on the middle stump line, squirted out to mid-on. He was trying to work it to the on side
back of a length. pushed out towards long-on for a single
short in length outside off, defended to point
gets forward to work this through to Umar Akmal at deep midwicket
gets back to defend this to the on side
leans well forward to defend to the off
just outside off, Roach is beaten, pushing inside the line
leans forward to work this off break to the leg side
stays back to defend it very compactly
full in length, on the off and middle, defended to midwicket
shuffles across to clip this to deep square-leg region for couple of runs
stays back to punch this to long-on for a single
Dropped by Younis at first slip. Tough chance. It was a short of length delivery angling across Roach who steered it to right of lone slip where Younis dived but could only get his finger tips on it
leans forward to ping long-on
Stylish whip through midwicket! 100 up. Roach has looked pretty good so far. This was on the leg and middle line and Roach whips it through midwicket
full delivery from over the stumps, pushed out to the off
short in length around off, pushed out to the cover region
on the pads, clipped to Hafeez at deep square-leg
gets back and across to play yet another very solid defensive stroke.
goes for the yorker but down the leg side ...brushes the boot may be
in the zone outside off, driven to mid-off
lands around the middle and moves away outside off, keeps a touch low, jabbed away to the off
fetches it from outside off and slaps it to long-on
slower, leg cutter from the off, defended to the off side
gets back to defend the length delivery to the off side of the pitch
slip down the leg side and Kamran dives to his left to stop it. Ooh la la
moves in towards middle stump line, pushed out to mid-on
full in length, around off, driven to extra cover
full in length around off, driven to extra cover
slants this one across Chanders who shoulders arms
from round the stumps now, in the zone outside off, steered to backward point
in the corridor outside off, left alone
drifts to the pads from the round the stumps angle, glanced away for a single
fullish delivery on the middle and off line, driven to mid-off. Again, a nice drive but straight to the fielder
around the off stump line, pushed out to point
on the pads, rolls away behind square-leg region
reverses into the off , worked away past square-leg
full in length around off, pushed through cover point
on the middle stump line, jabbed away to the on
on the middle stump line, turned to midwicket
on the middle and off, slow through the air, punched down to long-on
leg break outside off stump, pushed out through cover point
just outside off, pushed back to the bowler
outside the leg stump, worked through backward square-leg
outside the off stump line, defended of the back foot
slower, loopy flighted delivery outside off, square driven neatly to deep point
leans forward to punch this length delivery to mid-off
111 strikes, if you believe in those things. Roach, who batted so serenely, suddenly went for the slog over mid-on but dragged it to Younis at midwicket
fullish around off stump line, defended to the off
short in length , cutting across Ravi who defends to the off
gets back to punch this to cover
shuffles across to play out this slower to the leg side
slow leg break around off, turned to midwicket
gets back to work it past square-leg
Googly that landed outside leg stump, very full in length, Ravi went for the sweep, missed and the leg stump was pegged back. Afridi ends up with a four-for. West Indies have been rolled out for 112.

inn2.comm: back of a length outside off, Pakistan are away as Kamran guides to third man for a single

Hafeez smacks his first ball for four. And what a free-spirited stroke too! Short ball outside off, Hafeez waits for it and then slams the slashed upper cut well over point and all the way to the boundary. Roach needs to bowl fuller here.

not the start Roach would have wanted. Another short of a length ball outside off, Hafeez this time steers it along the ground backward of point. Hint of low bounce but Hafeez had no problems playing that shot

they are dancing in the aisles in Mirpur. Hafeez has played the shot of the match. Roach finally lands one fuller, but it is too straight and too full. It ends up on leg stump and Hafeez gets half forward to meet it on top of the bounce and send it packing past mid on. Top shot.
marginally shorter, at 135 kph, Hafeez gets a little greedy and goes for the pull shot. No room for it, he ends up under-edging towards midwicket
finally something close to the right length. On off stump, Hafeez check drives to mid off to end the over.
poor start from Rampaul, spears it down the leg side from wide of the crease and it clips the pads on the way to the fine leg fence.

Pakistan aren't looking to be out there for long. Kamran plays a controlled whiplash of a cut, even as he comes out of the crease. Rampaul lands it short outside off to scramble Kamran's improvisation, but Kamran holds his wits about him, waits for it to come on and slaps it away.
length ball coming in from off stump, Kamran covers the line and defends
well Rampaul said he never bowled as well as he had against India. Looks like he's some way from maintaining those standards. Another wide down the leg side
the radar functions this time, full length ball on middle and off, Kamran defends solidly to mid off
slower ball? Full on off stump, Kamran seemed to be early into the square drive, but waited on it and then steered it through point. Pollard got a hand on it and kept it down to one

good ball, but exemplary shot from Hafeez. Rampaul delivers a viciously tailing yorker on leg stump and Hafeez's toes seem to be in the firing line, even as he falls over in an attempt to flick. Or so it seems. The toes gets out of the way, the bat flashes down on the ball and sends it screaming away to square leg
back of a length outside off, Kamran gets behind and defends

dropped at point. Tony Cozier on air says the fielder is lucky the ball didn't take his fingers away. Pollard is wringing his hand in pain. Short ball, wide outside off, Kamran cracks the cut uppishly and Pollard at point jumps up. It skims his fingers and runs away for four
fuller and slower, no movement though. Kamran leans out to meet the ball and drive into the covers
short ball, not short enough for the pull, Kamran plays the shot all the same, and mistimes it
short of a length outside off, Kamran stays put on the crease and defends solidly
this time there is width outside off, Kamran opens the face and dabs down to third man for a single
again Rampaul sends down a yorker from wide of the crease, ends up on leg stump and Hafeez plays it away to the leg side
short of a length, again that inward movement, Hafeez stays on the crease and works it off the pads to midwicket
good line this, ends up outside off even as it draws Hafeez into another defensive push to the off side
over-pitched on off stump, too close to Hafeez for him to time the drive and he plays it sedately to mid off
width this time, just enough for Hafeez to crack square. His timing has been ominous today. Roach runs across from third man and only just manages to cut it off
rapped on the pads, the first appeal of the innings as Rampaul bends an inducker sharply into the pads and strikes him in front of leg. Surely was going down the leg side
full outside off, Kamran outside edges the walking cover drive and gets it down to third man for a single.
over-pitched on the pads, dabbed to midwicket for a single

footwork? "What footwork," says Kamran. And then adds, "Why footwork?" Tough to argue against that. He holds his stance as a back of length ball comes along outside off, and just dumps it on the up through point with a rapid uncorking of the wrists. Magnificent shot. Sehwagesque.
not so short this time, he steers more defensively into the off side
Roach's lengths have been all over the place. Another one squeezes onto the pads and gets flicked joyfully to deep midwicket.
Thomas drops a tough one down the leg side. Short ball angling down the leg side, Hafeez pulls and gets a thin edge that is dying away well to the left of a diving Thomas. He can't snare it.
flat delivery, straightens on off stump and Hafeez guides the cut to point
drift towards middle and leg, Hafeez gets half forward to defend
short of a length outside off, Hafeez cuts in front of point but can't get it away for runs
fuller on leg stump, he leans out to defend down the track
dabbed with the angle to the leg side, but not for runs
Bishoo produces a maiden out of no where. Full on off stump, Hafeez reaches forward and defends to the off side
short of a length outside off, Kamran plays from the crease but covers the line to defend
Kamran trots out well before Sammy delivers, but doesn't get a ball full enough to drive. He ends up defending to the off side
bends his back and digs this in well short, Kamran is again outside the crease but then stands tall to defend
once again Kamran fidgets out, gets a delivery angling into the pads and works it wide of mid on
a hint of width outside off, Kamran looks to steer a single through point but there's not enough room to make the play.
two maidens on the trot. Kamran gets half forward and check drives a length ball to mid off
Bishoo spears one on off stump, Hafeez cuts to point
runs after a long time. And a rank-bad ball helps break the monotony. Bishoo drags this really short and the ball turns away too. Hafeez has enough room to thwack it well in front of square
googly breaks in from outside off, Hafeez spots the deviation off the track and defends down the track
tossed up again outside off, Hafeez leans out to defend
Pakistan motor past 50 as Hafeez gets a thick edge as he looks to cut a short ball turning away from him. Pollard gives spirited chase, but there's no stopping that one.
leggie on leg stump, breaks away as Hafeez stays on the crease and covers the line

patent rubbish from Sammy. Drops a dawdling delivery short and wide outside off, and Kamran goes after it so hard he might end up doing a muscle or something. That wasn't cut, it was emphatically shredded through the covers
better length, Kamran gets forward and defends with an opened face into the off side
angling into the pads this time, Kamran stays put and defends to the leg side
comes slowly off the track as Sammy lands one back of a length outside off. Kamran looks at the toe end of the bat after mistiming the push into the covers off the back foot

complete lack of pace, movement or anything nearly costs Kamran his wicket. He mopes out of the crease and looks to slam Sammy across the line. The short of length ball misses the bat and goes through the bat-pad gap but misses the stumps
ends with a short of length ball outside off, Kamran stands tall and punches into the covers
fullish ball on middle and leg, Hafeez gets forward to defend
this one breaks away from middle and off, Hafeez defends again

this time Hafeez jumps out to look for the inside out loft over the covers. Bishoo holds the length back just enough to make Hafeez mistime it, but this being a Powerplay, there's no one to field it. Rampaul runs back from mid off, gets a bott somehow between the ball and the rope to save the fourth run
full delivery, straightens from off stump as Kamran defends
flatter and hurrying through, Kamran hangs back and guides to the off side
probably three inches wider outside off than last time, that's enough invitation for Kamran to try and play an attacking cut shot. He finds point though.
Sammy serves up another poor delivery, on the pads and angling further down in the early 120s kph. Hafeez helps it along with a dainty glance.
fuller and straighter, ends up on middle and off, Hafeez defends off the front foot into the covers
hint of width outside off, Hafeez gets forward and opens the face to steer it square for a single
top timing from Kamran. Back of a length ball that ended up on the pads, Kamran waited for it to come on and clipped it neatly through wide mid on.
fuller length on off stump, Hafeez looks to tip and run to the off side, but Kamran sends him back. Wants to do it in boundaries, I guess.
slower ball on a length on off stump, Hafeez defends off the front foot
loopy delivery on off stump, Kamran drives sedately through cover for a single
short of a length, but sharp away spin from outside off, Hafeez stays back and plays this down the track
fuller on off, Hafeez defends again
too much drift, ends up in the pads and Hafeez clips it easily to deep square leg for a couple
back of a length on off stump, Hafeez spots the googly and defends as it comes in
that's how you deal with mosquitoes in Mirpur. Or with rank-bad long hops. Short ball ends up on leg stump, Hafeez hangs back and whacks it in the air over midwicket for four more.
Sammy gets one to curve in a touch and Kamran flicks straight to midwicket
another slow offcutter, Kamran walks out and misses an ugly flat-footed swipe at it. The ball misses the off stump, but not by much.
better shot, gets behind the line and defends a length ball into the covers
an inside edge this time. This one stays low as Sammy takes the pace off. Inside edge runs away to the leg side
length ball outside off holds its line and Hafeez lets it go
width outside off, Hafeez plays a delicate steer to third man for a single

these Pakistan openers have played some real classy shots through the off side today. Another one from Hafeez as Bishoo offers a smidgin of width outside off, Hafeez waits and waits after rocking back and then opens the face to ensure he got it to the left of point.
good ball, Bishoo gets it to turn away sharply and Hafeez outside edges the defensive push almost into Gayle's hands, standing back at slip
too flat this time, Hafeez punches through mid off for one more
tossed up on off, Kamran gets to the pitch ans whips inside out to cover
short of a length outside off, Kamran taps it as it turns away into the off side for a single
short ball on leg and middle, Hafeez carefully works it to mid on
back of a length outside off, Kamran steers off the back foot to point
Kamran makes the adjustment this time, playing the steer a fraction later to beat point, and it is nearly four through deep backward point
length ball, angling into the pads and worked straight to Pollard at midwicket
126.7 kph came off slower from short of a length, and Kamran punched it on the up through the covers for one
hint of an inducker from outside off, Hafeez covers the line with bat and pad as he defends
that one stayed low, and Hafeez was in a spot of bother as he played back to it. He managed to work it away to the leg side for a single though
gets the first ball to angle in from wide of the crease, but Hafeez defends easily from the crease
half an appeal as Rampaul hits the pads with a huge inducker from wide of the stumps. Would have surely missed leg.
over-pitched outside off and ominous timing from Hafeez as he digs into an on the up cover drive. Can't beat the infield though.
not so full, and coming into the pads, Hafeez defends from the crease to the leg side
driving length ball outside off, Hafeez mistimes the cover drive
Rampaul continues to get some late inward nip, but the problem is, it is too late. Literally and otherwise. Hafeez gets forward and pushes assertively into the covers. Maiden over.
offcutter from outside off, Kamran plays forward and gets an inside edge away to midwicket
short delivery angling into the body, Kamran whips through midwicket for a single
fuller on off, and Hafeez meets it with a sweet push drive back at Roach who bends in a hurry to stop it
back of a length outside off, Hafeez stays back and defends to the off side for one
short ball on Kamran's middle and leg, he stays put on the back foot and defends down the leg side
over-pitched and tailing into the pads, Kamran whips without timing to midwicket

Mohd. Hafeez, take a bow. He's stamped his presence all over this huge game, and West Indies must be getting exasperated by him. Today, where ever they have turned in Mirpur, Hafeez has been there. Length ball outside off, Hafeez leans out to it perfectly, opens the face and caresses the square drive with just enough timing to reach the boundary. A fine fifty this.

even better! Rampaul goes fuller and straighter, Hafeez responds with an even more emphatic shot. Again, that smooth forward movement, gets him to the pitch and then he creams him with authority through extra cover
back of a length and sufficiently out side off for Hafeez to let go
he's got some consistent inward movement today, has Rampaul. This time Hafeez works him with the angle to midwicket
this one ends on middle and leg, Hafeez nudges to square leg
short of a length on middle to end the over, Hafeez looks to work it to the leg side, but can't get it off the square

one of those few occasions when a batsman has mishit something this evening. No worries, even that's gone for four. Roach hustles Kamran with a bouncer, and the top edge whistles away high and fine for four through the leg side
short ball, pushes Kamran back and he is on the hop as he defends towards point
length ball on off stump, Kamran gets half forward and check drives to mid off
another short ball, another pull and again Kamran can't get it away. In fact he's through the shot too early this time and takes a blow on the elbow. Ouch.
some more short stuff, Kamran is not getting into the best of positions to pull and heaves this away without making contact, towards the keeper
short again to end the over, Kamran hangs back and drops it to the off side
fullish ball on off and middle, played back down the track
Pakistan go past 100. Hafeez works it away to the outfield for three more. Nice and energetic running. All over bar the shouting for the WI.
back of a length on off stump, Kamran gets behind it and defends to the off side
over-pitched outside off, Kamran looks to lean into a punchy drive but finds mid off
slanted into the pads, Kamran works it without timing off the pads to the leg side

top-notch from Kamran. Roach has had him in strife with the short balls. No such problems against Rampaul who angles one too far in. Kamran stays inside the line and controls the pull with a pleasing roll of the wrists.

sorry West Indies, NOTHING is going your way today. Another top bouncer from Roach, has Hafeez in all sorts of trouble as he pulls. The top edge swirls into the Mirpur night and lands safe well in front of fine leg
back of a length again, Kamran skips inside the line and whips through backward square leg for a single
short again, outside off, Hafeez mistimes the cut but gets a single away backward of point
another bouncer from Roach, Kamran ducks under it in a hurry.

"That's a devastating win for Pakistan," yells Mark Nicholas on air. For once, it is not the usual Nicholas hyperbole too. Has there been a more emphatic win in a World Cup quarter-final? Kamran puts West Indies out of their misery by muscling a short of length ball outside off in front of point. Pakistan have knocked West Indies out of World Cup 2011.
